targets.expr:
(min by(id, name) (
  timestamp(container_last_seen{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"})
  -
  container_last_seen{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}
  or
  time() - max_over_time(container_last_seen{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__range])
))

panels.description: Empty is container doesn't have cpu limit.
panels.title: CPU throttled (average)

panels.description: sum_over_time of seconds spent throtting. Empty is container doesn't have cpu limit.
panels.title: CPU throttled (total time)

targets.expr:
max by($split_ids) (
  (rate(container_cpu_system_seconds_total{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
  /
  sum without(cpu) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id", cpu="total"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-12)
)

# if container didn't run at some interval, you will have division by zero, so we do ` / increase + epsilon`
max by($split_ids) (
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) )
/
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-5 )
)

options.content:
- `rss` is anon memory
- `wss` = rss + active cache
- Cache is active if it used _often_ (more than once?)

- WSS reaching limit causes file cache garbage collection
- RSS reaching limit causes OOM kill

targets.expr:
max by($split_ids) (
  max_over_time(container_memory_rss{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  or
  max_over_time(container_memory_rss{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
)

max by($split_ids) (
    (
        max_over_time(container_memory_rss{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
        or
        max_over_time(container_memory_rss{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
/
    (max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval]) != 0)
)

max by($split_ids) (
  + avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  - avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  or
  + avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
  - avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
)

max by($split_ids) (
  (
      + avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
      - avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
      or
      + avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
      - avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
  )
/
    (max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval]) != 0)
)

max by($split_ids) (
  max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  or
  max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
)

max by($split_ids) (
    (
        max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
        or
        max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
    )
/
    (max_over_time(container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{instance="$instance", name=~"$name", id=~"$id"}[$__interval]) != 0)
)

options.content:
Read/write from NFS and SMB shares
will not be shown in the storage throughput.

Cadvisor exports data from cgroup io.stats,
which are only calculated for block devices.
